chav1961.purelib.fsys

Class AbstractFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.fsys.AbstractFileSystem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FileSystemInterface, Closeable, AutoCloseable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FileSystemOnFile, FileSystemOnRMI, FileSystemOnXMLReadOnly

    public abstract class AbstractFileSystem
extends Object
implements FileSystemInterface

    This abstract class implements the most of all FileSystemInterface functionality.

    You can use this class as a basic class for your own file system implementations. To use it, you need override the three methods:

    • FileSystemInterface.canServe(String) method to test URI scheme this file system implementation can serve (see FileSystemFactory)
    • clone() method to make a quick copy of the file system instance
    • createDataWrapper(URI) method to get direct access to the file system entity.

    As a good example, see FileSystemOnFile class implementation.

    Don't use the class as a type of variables or parameters in your program. Use the FileSystemInterface interface instead in all these cases

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Since:
    0.0.1
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    FileSystemInterface, FileSystemOnFile, JUnit tests

      • createDataWrapper

        public abstract DataWrapperInterface createDataWrapper(URI actualPath)
                                                throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: FileSystemInterface

        Get data wrapper interface for the given file system cursor path

        Specified by:
        createDataWrapper in interface FileSystemInterface
        Parameters:
        actualPath - path toget data wrapper for. Always is relative, normalized and always starts with the '/'.
        Returns:
        data wrapper for the actual path. Never can be null. If object with the given path is not exists, you need at least fill the ATR_EXISTS attribute for the getAttributes() method call.
        Throws:
        IOException - if any exceptions was thrown
